This was our last dinner while in Spain for a week.  I think it was also one of the best we had.  They don't take reservations, so we showed up at 9pm with a group of 6.  Amazingly, we only had to wait for 10 minutes.  Service was excellent.  Polite, efficient and always attentive.  The manager/owner was all over the restaurant, directing traffic, helping staff and ensuring everyone was enjoying their meals all with a smile.  The food is excellent, maybe because they have foie?  The foie pate, the foie over fries, the grilled pawns, the gazpacho, iberico ham croquettes, fried eggplant.. amazing.  They are known for their sandwiches, which are good but the starters were the stars of the show.  Dessert was great too.I know there are awesome places to eat in Barcelona, but compared to the great pintxos places in San Sebastian, La Pepita can go head to head.
